SEARCH
Package gw.api.financials

Class FinancialsCalculator<C extends FinancialsCalculator>

java.lang.Object
gw.api.financials.FinancialsCalculator<C>
Direct Known Subclasses:
FinancialsCalculatorWithReservingAmount
public class FinancialsCalculator<C extends FinancialsCalculator> extends Object
A FinancialsCalculator contains information on how a financials calculation can be made. Specifically, it knows which TAccounts to be added or subtracted for every reserve line, and it knows how to collect and filter the reserve lines to be combined.
Author:
rvernick

    • clear

      public void clear()
      Resets the state of the calculator, allowing for a fresh specification of the amount criteria

    • withClaim

      public FinancialsCalculator withClaim(Claim claim)
      Use the claim provided as the source of financial information for a calculation.

      When used alone, this method selects all reserves lines on the claim. To select only claim-level reserve lines, also call useClaimLevelReserves().

    • withReserveLine

      public FinancialsCalculatorWithReservingAmount withReserveLine(ReserveLine reserveLine)
      Use the reserve line provided as the source of financial information for a calculation.

      This method must not be combined with withClaim(Claim) or withExposure(Exposure), unless one of the values given is null.

    • withRecoveryCoding

      public FinancialsCalculatorWithReservingAmount withRecoveryCoding(RecoveryCoding recoveryCoding)

    • withRecoveryCategory

    • withExposure

      public C withExposure(Exposure exposure)
      Use the exposure provided as the source of financial information for a calculation.

      This method may be combined with withClaim(Claim) only if the given exposure is actually from that same claim (or if the given exposure is null).

    • withTransactionSetAsIfSubmitted

      public C withTransactionSetAsIfSubmitted(TransactionSet tset)
      For transactions in the TransactionSet, simulate transitioning them to Submitted status before evaluating the FinancialsCalculation. This lets you see the value of the Financials Calculation as if the transactions have been approved and sent downstream. Only transactions that match other filtering criteria of this FinancialsCalculator will be transitioned.

    • noNulls

      public C noNulls()
      By default, getAmount will return null if there are no contributing transactions. This method will have the call return a non-null zero amount if there are no contributing transactions
      Returns:
      this

    • useClaimLevelReserves

      public C useClaimLevelReserves()
      Only include transactions from claim-level reserve lines for a calculation.

      This method may only be called if withClaim(Claim) is also called with a non-null value, except that this method is simply ignored if withExposure(Exposure) is also called with a non-null value.

    • hasContributingTransactions

      public boolean hasContributingTransactions()
      Lets the caller know if there are any applicable transactions for the calculation
